limit.description: The number of records to fetch. The value must be greater than 0, and no greater than 1000.

skip.description: The number of records to skip. The value must not be less than 0.

where.description: Constrains values for fields. The value should be encoded JSON.

order.description: A dictionary of one or more fields specifying sorting of results. In general, you can sort based on any predefined field that you can query using the where operator, as well as on custom fields. The value should be encoded JSON.

sel.description: Selects which fields to return from the query. Others are excluded. The value should be encoded JSON.

unsel.description: Selects which fields to not return from the query. Others are included. The value should be encoded JSON.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.metaDescription: The number of records to fetch.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.metaDescription: The number of records to skip.

parameters.name: where
parameters.metaDescription: JSON-encoded object specifying field constraints. The field name is the key and the value is the constraint statement or value.

parameters.name: order
parameters.metaDescription: A dictionary of key-value pairs describing the field(s) for sorting. The field name is the key and the value is set to either -1 for ascending order or 1 for descending order.

parameters.name: sel
parameters.metaDescription: A dictionary of key-value pairs describing which fields to include in the query results. The field name is the key and the value is set to 1.

parameters.name: unsel
parameters.metaDescription: A dictionary of key-value pairs describing which fields to exclude from the query results. The field name is the key and the value is set to 1.
